Actually I don’t even remember the code I posted… Or the conversation. But whatever, what’s the point? This isn’t going to get anywhere. You guys will probably think I’m an idiot for having 177 rep and posting a suggestion that wouldn’t hurt to try. When you think of it, there’s really no reason why it shouldn’t be working if it’s using the right methods, has the right syntax, and is in the proper place.

item.title: Command issue[Has code posted]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

So this isn’t spam, I’ll post something else.

YOU ARE A SHITTY LITTLE MOPARSCAPER THAT CAN ONLY EDIT EXISTING JAVA SHIT! IT IS REALLY NOT PROGRAMMING! When I left, I learned a lot more and not much about Java. I’ve made several programs, too; even games (Not in Game Maker either. In C# and C++.)

The last time I was truely active and just into private servers day and night doing everything was over a year ago. I got repped mainly for client things. When I quit I had around 100 rep. Some of my friends, and other people, randomly repped me. It even happened today.

Now, for the command issue…
Try adding the stuff you want to happen in a different command. If it happens properly, then remove the previous stuff. If it works, then you were adding the “pure” command in the wrong spot or it was the name (Which wouldn’t happen.)

Now, let’s not turn this into a flame war. If you wanna talk shit to me, add me on MSN: InfiniteSkater@hotmail.com and you can flame me all you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Command issue[Has code posted]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Instead of putting where you are, put it right after the else of a different command. You might have to add an else after the } but it will all turn out right. Also, do NOT get rid of the brackets like that. Non-bracketed if statements only go for the next line, and same with non-bracketed elses.

Read full topic
